definition: straight/to straighten/fair and reasonable/frank/straightforward/(indicates continuing motion or action)/vertical/vertical downward stroke in Chinese characters
surname Zhi/Zhi (c. 2000 BC), fifth of the legendary Flame Emperors 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God

sentences.english: He would not sleep like a corpse, nor stt like a guest.
sentences.chinese: 孔子睡觉不像死尸那样僵直，家居不像做客那样端坐。

sentences.english: She leapt backwards, back arched and fur on end, tail held out stiffly.
sentences.chinese: 她向后一跃，脊背拱起，毛发竖立，尾巴僵直地伸着。

sentences.english: Stealing a glance, I noticed her back was ramrod-straight.
sentences.chinese: 偷偷的瞟了她一眼，我发现她的背僵直着。

sentences.english: Chroniger stiffens as Kumar inserts the small needles into his damaged neck.
sentences.chinese: 在小银针插入他的受伤的脖子时，库马尔全身僵直。

sentences.english: Objective To sum up a new surgical method to treat knee ankylosis with skeletal traction following arthrolysis.
sentences.chinese: 目的总结一种治疗膝关节僵直的新手术方法。

sentences.english: Within a few hours rigor mortis would set in.
sentences.chinese: 过几小时尸体就会僵直。

sentences.english: Fauchelevent recovered, his knee remained stiff. M.
sentences.chinese: 割风的伤医好，膝头却是僵直的。

definition: to stagnate/to congeal/(fig.) to stop still/to freeze
to twitch/to throb/a spasm/to extract and use
